A Game of Minds

Dimly lit room, tense atmosphere  
Raskolnikov: “If I were guilty, I’d admit delirium.”  

Porfiry: “But you’re persistent, aren’t you?”  

Raskolnikov: “You’re trying to scare me, aren’t you?”  

---  

Same room, Raskolnikov uneasy  
Raskolnikov: “You know my thoughts before I say them.”  

Porfiry: “You keep lying, don’t you?”  

Raskolnikov: “The truth is the best policy!”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov struggles with his guilt and paranoia as Porfiry questions his honesty regarding his involvement in a crime.
